conclusion: For an ideal gas, any state satisfies the ideal-gas relation PV = nRT, where nR is constant for the fixed mass of gas in this cycle.
State C lies directly above D on the diagram, so the pressure at C is P₂ and the volume is V₂.
Applying the ideal-gas relation at C: P₂V₂ = nRT_C.
Divide the equation for state C by that for state A to eliminate nR: (P₂V₂) / (P₁V₁) = T_C / T₀.
Solve for T_C: T_C = T₀ • (P₂ / P₁) • (V₂ / V₁).
Hence, the temperature at state C is T_C = T₀ (P₂ / P₁)(V₂ / V₁).
